intro: Stylidium obtusatum, commonly known as the blunt-stemmed jewelweed, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a member of the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It typically grows in moist, sunny habitats such as wetlands and grassy areas. Its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed soils make it an adaptable species within its native range.
